actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to prevent loss of medicaid eligibility (by reason of the recent increase in social security benefits) of certain individuals who, immediately before such increase, were eligible (as recipients of mandatory State supplementary payments) for medicaid.

summary.text: Imposes conditions (effective March 1, 1974) for the approval of any State plan under title XIX of the Social Security Act (Medicaid) requiring that specified individuals shall remain eligible as recipients of mandatory State supplementary payments under medicaid, notwithstanding the recent increase in social security benefits.

titles.title: A bill to prevent loss of medicaid eligibility (by reason of the recent increase in social security benefits) of certain individuals who, immediately before such increase, were eligible (as recipients of mandatory State supplementary payments) for medicaid.
